org.apache.oodt.commons.util

Class Base64

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.oodt.commons.util.Base64

  • public class Base64
extends Object
    Base 64 encoding and decoding. This class provides methods for RFC-1521 specified "base 64" encoding and decoding of arbitrary data. Pass a byte array into the encode(byte[]) method and you'll get a byte array result where all of the bytes are printable ASCII values. Pass that result into decode(byte[]) and you'll get your original byte array.

    Sincere thanks to Tom Daley for providing a sample encoder algorithm and a great explanation of how RFC-1521 is supposed to work.

    Author:
    Kelly

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public static byte[] encode(byte[] data)
        Encode into base 64. Encode the given data into RFC-1521 base 64. Encoding a null array gives a null result.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to encode.
        Returns:
        Base-64 encoded data.

      • encode

        public static byte[] encode(byte[] data,
                            int offset,
                            int length)
        Encode into base 64. Encode the given data into RFC-1521 base 64. Encoding a null array gives a null result. Start encoding at the given offset and go for the given amount of bytes.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to encode.
        offset - Where to start looking for data to encode.
        length - How much data to encode.
        Returns:
        Base-64 encoded data

      • decode

        public static byte[] decode(byte[] data)
        Decode from base 64. Decode the given RFC-1521 base 64 encoded bytes into the original data they represent. Decoding null data gives a null result.
        Parameters:
        data - Base-64 encoded data to decode.
        Returns:
        Decoded data.

      • decode

        public static byte[] decode(byte[] data,
                            int offset,
                            int length)
        Decode from base 64. Decode the given RFC-1521 base 64 encoded bytes into the original data they represent. Decoding null data gives a null result.
        Parameters:
        data - Base-64 encoded data to decode.
        offset - Where to start looking for data to decode.
        length - How much data to decode.
        Returns:
        Decoded data.
